ticket.title: Urgent: Pacing Script Update: 06/13: Enterprise Campaigns

nonEditableReason.message: To set an epic as the parent, use the epic link instead

issuetype.description: A user story. Created by JIRA Software - do not edit or delete.
issuetype.name: Story

content.text: We are here looking for your help in updating the pacing scripts with the mentioned modifications for the
Enterprise campaigns (non SBG & non Drive Auto)
for the rollover of over-impressions served in the previous month to the current and future months.
of the updated pacing goal to the next month order goal if the campaigns over-paced more than 10% of the current month updated goal.
Have created over-pacing cases with the roll-over calculations for better understanding.
Please feel free to reach out for any questions.
Note: IT NEEDS TO BE EXECUTED ONLY FOR 07/01 NOON VERSION PACING SHEET AND ONWARDS

content.text: a year and a half ago. We postponed the implementation in

Currently, we only display creative previews for static display creative and MP4 video creatives. More and more orders have HTML5, Javascript and VAST creatives, including Xandr Native Display campaigns. They have the potential to be different creative types - static PNG/JPG/GIF or HTML5 or Javascript, etc.
Dashboard FE team needs BE to provide the backup image file’s URL to be able to show the creative preview for HTML5 creatives.
. This ticket is now for Facebook only.
Please implement what was done for Xandr in
Examples to test with on Prod:
We will have HTML5 backup image URL for Facebook campaigns to provide to FE team.
1st A: We’ll push to prod by the end of today.
2nd A: Based on this request, what would be the appropriate categorization for the creatives? DE Option: If they have the

property, they are assigned as HTML5 — but what about the others? Furthermore, this categorization and the creation of the new column are out of scope for the current ticket, and it is too late to include them, as the sprint is about to close. Please contact
to include it in the next sprint based on its priority.

comment.extractedText: Hi @@Artem Katnov,  1st A: We’ll push to prod by the end of today.2nd A: Based on this request, what would be the appropriate categorization for the creatives? DE Option: If they have the template_data.link property, they are assigned as HTML5 — but what about the others? Furthermore, this categorization and the creation of the new column are out of scope for the current ticket, and it is too late to include them, as the sprint is about to close. Please contact @@Antoine Dubuc to include it in the next sprint based on its priority. cc:  @@Grover Rivera

ticket.title: (MP)1st party data segment appearing in Segment Library for all agencies to select

issuetype.name: Bug

nonEditableReason.message: To set an epic as the parent, use the epic link instead

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

content.text: Segment created with 1st party data is appearing in the Segment Library, making it selectable not only for other advertisers within Ferocious Digital, but potentially for other agency partners as well. This is a big violation of access to 1st party data and needs to be resolved immediately before we are liable for any data access issues.

fields.summary: (MP)1st party data segment appearing in Segment Library for all agencies to select

content.text: Segment created with 1st party data is appearing in the Segment Library, making it selectable not only for other advertisers within Ferocious Digital, but potentially for other agency partners as well. This is a big violation of access to 1st party data and needs to be resolved immediately before we are liable for any data access issues.

fields.summary: (MP)1st party data segment appearing in Segment Library for all agencies to select

content.text: I cloned the original prod issue for this, but it appears to be happening again…This is from an agency client:
I am working on a proposal this morning and saw a client's data again.
I thought we resolved this and are NOT showing these audiences on the platform.
I first saw it under injury.
What steps can we take to present this from happening before we scale users?
Basically, we’re not filtering out 1st party data segments (segments owned by a specific agency) from being visible from ALL agencies in the Media Planner.
This is powered by the ATS audience targeting service, using data pulled by data team.  We need to filter out any 1P segments…
build a blacklisting tool.  is there a way to see how this one got through blacklisting?
could you add in the whole segment name here?

comment.extractedText: @@Antoine Dubuc I cloned the original prod issue for this, but it appears to be happening again…This is from an agency client: Hi Team, I am working on a proposal this morning and saw a client's data again. I thought we resolved this and are NOT showing these audiences on the platform.  I first saw it under injury.   What steps can we take to present this from happening before we scale users?  Thank you!    Basically, we’re not filtering out 1st party data segments (segments owned by a specific agency) from being visible from ALL agencies in the Media Planner.   This is powered by the ATS audience targeting service, using data pulled by data team.  We need to filter out any 1P segments… @@Irina Groylova build a blacklisting tool.  is there a way to see how this one got through blacklisting?   @@Matthew Wurman could you add in the whole segment name here?

content.text: I cloned the original prod issue for this, but it appears to be happening again…This is from an agency client:
I am working on a proposal this morning and saw a client's data again.
I thought we resolved this and are NOT showing these audiences on the platform.
I first saw it under injury.
What steps can we take to present this from happening before we scale users?
Basically, we’re not filtering out 1st party data segments (segments owned by a specific agency) from being visible from ALL agencies in the Media Planner.
This is powered by the ATS audience targeting service, using data pulled by data team.  We need to filter out any 1P segments…
build a blacklisting tool.  is there a way to see how this one got through blacklisting?
could you add in the whole segment name here?

issuetype.description: A user story. Created by JIRA Software - do not edit or delete.
issuetype.name: Story

content.text: The DE team already investigated the API and confirmed we are able to pull metrics for Dashboard.
Have the data in Bronze, Silver and Gold Layers.
Gold Layer numbers should match all the current yahoo tables in mySQL (proof that we enhanced our data quality)
Gold Layer numbers should match the Yahoo UI (proof of our data quality)
At the end of pipeline make sure data is ready for Dashboard (eg: prevent missing data in input or output, job failures, data anomalies). Alert in case of data failures.

content.text: regarding this ticket I have worked on the following tasks:
Understand the documentation provided by Antoine
Review the code created by Arthur
Explain to Arthur how the pipelines are orchestrated and what the promotion-to-production process looks like.
Some tech debts that we currently have in the architecture.
